{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3496512,"name":null,"username":"VoltageVikings6620","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/v/7ba0ec/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-30T12:16:23.013Z","cooked":"

Hello everyone previously when we wanted to set the speed of a motor we would used code similar to:
motorname.set(value between 0 and 1);
However, ever since the new 2025 changes I have been getting errors when I use this. Is there a work around? What should we do?

VoltageVikings6620:

getting errors

What errors and what have you already tried to fix it?

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-01-30T14:47:07.920Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":73,"readers_count":72,"score":14.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":484274,"topic_slug":"motor-speed-set-change","display_username":"SLAB-Mr.Thomas","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24594,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/motor-speed-set-change/484274/4","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3496728,"name":null,"username":"VoltageVikings6620","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/v/7ba0ec/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-30T16:04:21.157Z","cooked":"

The motor controller we are using are Vex under the class VictorSPX and the code is:
VictorSPX lift1 = new VictorSPX(1);
VictorSPXConfiguration config2 = new VictorSPXConfiguration();
boolean isPullingup = false;
boolean button3statelast = false;
double output = 0.5;
private static final int button3 = 4;
boolean islift1 = false;
private boolean liftworks = false;
private boolean lastButtonState = false;

if (button3state && !button3state){
liftworks = !liftworks;
}
if (liftworks){
if(!islift1){
lift1.set(output);
}else{
lift1.set(0);
}
}

I believe with the VictorSPX you need to set the control mode when doing .set(). Like this: motor.set(VictorSPXControlMode.PercentOutput, speed);

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":7,"updated_at":"2025-01-30T16:14:56.615Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":39,"readers_count":38,"score":12.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":484274,"topic_slug":"motor-speed-set-change","display_username":"James","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51278,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/motor-speed-set-change/484274/6","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3496737,"name":"James","username":"JamerGamer789","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/e19b73/{size}.png","created_at":"2025-01-30T16:16:15.612Z","cooked":"

The VictorSPX has different control modes, so you need to specify which one to use. PercentOutput matches the type of control you are looking for.
